name: Ecola Creek Lodge

reviews.text: I have been visiting Cannon Beach since I was a very young child. Some things have changed over the years, one thing has not...finding a nice place to stay in Cannon Beach at a reasonable price is nearly impossible. Not anymore! Ecola Creek Lodge is a very affordable quaint property positioned just north of "downtown" Cannon Beach.
reviews.title: Rare Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was hesitant to book due to the low price and lack of minimum stay requirement (checked in on Sunday). I am glad I did as the value for the price is very good. Front desk staff was very welcoming. We stayed in room #7 which had a very comfortable queen bed, less comfortable sleeper sofa, gas fireplace, and a small fridge and microwave. A perfect space for a couple or family with a young child.
reviews.title: Just right for us

reviews.text: We will return!
reviews.title: Can't Say Enough Good Things!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ecola Creek Lodge is a small inn that is just outside town, close enough for an easy walk into town, and just far enough out so that the nearby beach is not as busy as the one adjacent to town, which is separated from the beach nearby by a small stream. Very friendly staff, fresh baked cookies in the lobby. We were in room 18, I believe, which had a kitchenette, whirlpool tub (no shower), and a glimpse of the ocean. Low headroom in some spaces for this particular room, but a very nice space and a terrific value for the price. Cannon Beach was a very nice little town for a weekend visit, too.
reviews.title: Comfortable, quiet

reviews.text: When visiting Seaside and Cannon Beach Oregon ( About 8 or 10 miles apart) I always stay at Cannon Beach and always stay at The Ecola Creek Lodge. As I have stated in previous reviews of another Oregon Coast hotel, if you can do without the pool and spa, Ecola is just awsome. Very nice clean rooms. Excellent staff. Beautiful grounds with koi pond and bunnies everywhere. Not far from beautilul Ecola State Park. Rooms with and without kitchens, 1 and 2 bedrooms or small studio rooms. Can fit all budgets. Very family friendly. Very close to the boardwalk area to visit beautiful galleries,shops and good dining. Great place to stay that is so close to other north Oregon Coast attractions. Seaside,Ft Stevens,Ft Clatsop,and Astoria.
reviews.title: Lovely motel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An unusual property with all rooms opening off the external paths. Other than housekeeping, Internet and coffee in reception there are no services provided. There is a guest laundry.
reviews.title: Not really either hotel nor motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was comfortable and clean with ventilation provided by opening windows, a sofa bed and couple of easy chairs. Heating system and gas fire for the colder months. There was a table and a couple of chairs outside the door and also some seating in the garden.
reviews.title: Very nice stay
Exactly what we were looking for.
reviews.text: Our room faced the road to the park and the beach so there was a lot off traffic in the evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although a short walk to 'downtown' rather a longer walk to the main central area.
reviews.title: Pretty good - nice front desk clerk. Ladies, pass on the made up remover in the bathroom...made with animal products

reviews.text: If you want a clean comfortable room a little out of town and the price is right this could be a good choice.
reviews.title: Excellent little place

reviews.text: This being my first time to Oregon I was hoping to have a good time. I drove from Portland Airport directly to the Lodge and was greated by a warm smile, hot coffee and freshly baked cookies. I checked in with ease and was very pleased with my queen guestroom (with queen sofa sleeper) and gas fireplace room. The fireplace came in handy since the temperature dropped. The bed was comfy! The Lodge is within walking distance to restaurants and shopping. The road leading to Ecola State Park is also very close. I highly recommend the lodge to anyone traveling this way.
reviews.title: Superb accomodations

reviews.text: Centrally located for everything. We could walk to the beach and downtown as well as drive to Seaside and Tillamook. Everyone was happy! The room was clean and suitable for everyone! The only annoying bit was the noisy refrigerator and plumbing. Great place to take our dog, too!
reviews.title: Good location...reasonable price~

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I made a reservation on Hotels.com for a room with a fireplace and they (Hotels.com) had made a mistake on the description. So when I showed up at Ecola Creek Lodge, the reservation on file for me was a single/non-fireplace. Luckily it was off-season and middle of the week, so Ecola upgraded me to their biggest suite (with a fireplace) and didn't charge me any extra. It was great! The place was like an apartment, tons of space, kitchen, etc. I hope to get back there soon!
reviews.title: Favorite place on our trip

reviews.text: The manager did say they had trouble with Hotels.com giving the wrong description of the rooms, so be careful if you go that route.
reviews.title: Great Location Just Off Of Downtown & The Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for three nights in early September. The Ecola Creek Lodge has a great location just off of downtown & the beach. Charming buildings. Very nice grounds and gardens. A fair price. Very nice lady at the check in counter. We had a comfortable and clean room. And, a nice stay. We look forward to going back.
reviews.title: I love the beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very well kept, quaint and reasonably priced motel in an otherwise fairly expensive town. The room we stayed in was extremely small, mostly just room for the bed, but I believe that we had one of the smallest rooms due to the price that we paid. The bathroom was very nicely sized, kind of a strange counterpart to the size of the living quarters.
reviews.title: Friendly place

reviews.text: The room was exceptionally clean, and the grounds and all other appearances of the motel very nicely kept and pleasant.
reviews.title: Classic, Comfortable Charmer

reviews.text: I had interactions with three different people at the front desk and each was very friendly and helpful in giving me advice about the town or directions to our destinations around the area. Coffee, cider, and treats are always available in the office, another nice touch.
reviews.title: Better than expected!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We highly recommend this affordable motel in a town where lodging prices are generally high.
reviews.title: wow.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have visited this hotel for more than 30 years--and it has never looked better! Built in the 1940s, the suites at the Ecola Creek Lodge exude charm. We stayed in the one-bedroom Turret Suite with a large living room and cozy kitchen. The koi pond and occasional visiting bunny only add to the ambience. If you're looking for ultra-modern, then this isn't the spot for you. But if you want a warm, inviting place with vintage appeal and modern amenities (like wifi), this is the spot. The pet-friendly rooms are fine, but the real value is in the one- and two-bedroom suites with fireplaces that face the front. We could not have been more comfortable, and it's only a five-minute walk to the beach.
reviews.title: Very welcoming and cozy!

description: One of Cannon Beach's most inviting places to stay, "Where Oregon Coast beauty meet New England charm". Ecola Creek Lodge consists of four buildings with their distinct Cape Cod architecture, and are surrounded by spacious lawns, gardens and a beautiful koi pond water feature. The 'classically' decorated Guestrooms range from Studios to one and two bedroom Suites with kitchens. We're located on the quiet North end of town just two blocks from the beach and a five minute stroll to downtown Cannon Beach's shops and galleries.
